author: Gen O.

description: Sutro Heights Park is a gem of a park, with beautiful Ocean views, flowers, and a few picnic tables with views of the waves crashing below.  This is a small neighborhood park, and while I would like to keep it to myself, this is a wonderful place to spend an afternoon.  There are steps which descend to Ocean Beach as you walk downhill towards Sutro Heights Avenue....just walk down the path that runs along the side of the big, haunted looking house which is the first house at the edge of the park, and voila, steps to the left of you...and another spectacular view, which you might just have to yourself.
author: George S.

description: Quiet and a great place to have a picnic on the grass or use the tables. Its a great place for kids and a dog-friendly park. Overlooks the ocean beach!
author: Liana C.

description:
the views are amazing from this spot... it's definately a great place to go on a nice and clear day....
you can't help but fall in love with san francisco all over again once you come here...
author: charlotte s.

description: Shhhhhh...Don't tell anyone but this place is special.  It has always been my super secret spot and I am sure I am not alone. It is beautiful, peaceful and above the ocean - what more can you ask for?
author: Liz N.

description: When we're not fogged in, it's a great place to walk up to and see the amazing views down along the Great Highway and the surrounding area.  I can't imagine the what it would have been like to live there and I'm glad it's a park instead of some rich person's home now.
author: Surf R.

description: I feel truly fortunate to have this lovely park to come to and breathe deeply, take in the majesty, thank the cosmos (and the Parks Department ) for this gift of a place. Just to saunter around, enjoy a picnic with friends, make out with my man,  or get some cardio going, Sutro Heights Park is one of the most beautiful spots in the city (and country).
author: Agent F.

description: One of the best kept secrets...shhhh, don't tell anyone.
author: Rebecca G.

description: This is an AMAZING park and is definitely one of my favorite spots in the City. I live completely on the opposite side of town but make a point to go to this park at least once a month just because it is so good for the soul. Even with all the touristy crap around, this park is still quiet and peaceful, and also well maintained. The only real downside is that sometimes the Muni buses sit idling across the street and you can smell the exhaust on those rare days when the air is still.
author: John R.

description:
aah... enjoy the warm breeze sweeping from the ocean and the glittering sun.... 
it is amazing up here. sweeping views, open space... wow.
author: Court L.

description: This place really is a hidden gem.  I have run past this park so many times and never really considered it.  Today my friend and I decided to venture in.  It was right around sunset and the air had a misty san francisco spring quality with birds flying about, children playing amongst lillie's and great views down of the great wide ocean beach.  There are palm trees and lovely expanses of grass.  I was really happy to pause here for a minute on our run.  On another note, one time while running by I witnessed what seriously looked like some sort of cult meeting of men in black trench coats in a circle.  This sorta weirded me out a bit.  Don't go here at night.  But don't, in fact, go anywhere that is not well lit at night.  It just isn't so smart.  And always wear white at night!  (That was a free take home message from my dad greg.)  Bottom line: this a great spot to take friends and loved one's during the day.
author: Lauren S.

description: I love this park. I've made some wonderful friends here walking my dog over the years. Maybe all dog people are good people. We have a couple of pot lucks a year and it's just a lovely, neighborhood place that makes me so grateful that when I finally settled down, dis neighborhood was de place. Never too crowded, lots of well behaved dogs of all sizes, sometimes on leash, sometimes off. The law is on leash but..just be warned of the crazy lady who calls the park police if your dog is off leash if you're coming from the Anza and Camino entrance. Keep them on leash until you pass the first meadow, but you didn't hear that from me!  Also a lovely park for running, strolling, picnicking, whale watching and just generally being grateful to be alive. The view from the Parapet, where the old house used to be, is breathtaking. Look for the stunning statue of Diana just east of the main walkway. Sometimes cold and foggy, always an amazing park.
author: Sharon J.

description: i love this park.. the sun shines through the trees, the fog creeps up the cliffs.. you've got a nice view of all of ocean beach, a bit of the richmond and sunset, the park, marin, mussel rock.. it's a wonderful place..  i think i've found a good plot of land for my house.
author: Pflip W.

description: i love taking a run to sutro park on sunny days because you get an amazing view of ocean beach and the great highway.  the grass is always lush and it's pretty secluded most of the times, so it feels like your own little hideaway.
author: Amy Z.

description: I love this little tiny park on a makeshift cliff!  It's very small, but oh so quaint.  It's located across the street from the cliffhouse atop that big rocky cliff.  It seems more or less to be a place where people walk their dogs, but it has a bit other city charm to it.  I would almost compare to Frasier's apartment on the show, where he used the decorating technique of using single fine pieces that stand alone individually, and since they are all nice pieces, they work together without having to be part of some overall design.  There's a statue, there's a strange castle-esque wall, there's individual trees that don't seem to belong there, a small rolling hill, a palatial style balcony that overlooks the ocean, do i need to keep going? It's not big, but if you want a little time to reflect on a cloudy day and want to see the western coastline of San Francisco here's the spot.  Just not everybody ok? I don't want this place overcrowded....
author: Raffi Y.

description: This is without a doubt the best park in San Francisco.  Just walking around it is a zen-like experience.  In fact, the last time was there was a group doing tai chi on the stone platform where Adolph Sutro's house used to sit.  It looked like a setting for Mortal Combat.  The park is also completely secluded--I live only a couple blocks away and only found it by accident.  You can't get better views.
author: Nick K.
